Godley ISD Throwback Thursday: Thank you, thank you, thank you to GHS class of ‘64 Johnny Bridges & class of 1950 Dick Bridges for bringing me this awesome gift. Not only did they buy lunch, but they brought me the framed 1922 Godley High School diploma of Edna Willis, their Mom. Edna worked for Godley ISD for many years after graduation. They also brought me their brother, class of 1947, Charles Bridges’ picture for our Alumni Military wall of honor along with his Military service award. If you look close, you can see that Johnny and Dick are standing next to their pictures on our wall of honor. Thanks also to their extended family for all the stories about Johnny, Dick, and Charles, and thanks to all that help us recognize and celebrate our Wildcat history and tradition. Go Wildcats!

The health, safety, and security of our students who ride our school buses are always Godley ISD's top priority! While we encourage parents & guardians who can transport their children to school in another way to do so, we do understand that is not feasible for all of our families.

In order to keep our students as safe as possible while on the bus, the following protocols and guidelines will be enforced for the upcoming school year:
-Bus Drivers will be trained in COVID-19 safety protocols.
-ALL students, regardless of age, will be required to wear face-covering/mask at all times when riding the bus.
-Drivers and monitors will wear a face-covering/mask.
-Seats, handles, and high-touch areas will be disinfected after each use
-When possible, bus windows will be opened to allow outside air to circulate in the bus.

Our Transportation Protocol & Safety Measures Plan can be read here: https://tinyurl.com/yyplezje

Please contact your child's campus or our Transportation Department with any questions you may have regarding bus transportation!

Happy Census Day!

We are proud to partner with U.S. Census Bureau to encourage a complete and accurate count for the #2020Census. Census Day is important because whenever you complete your #2020Census, you should count everyone living (or sleeping) in your home most of the time as of April 1—whether you are related to them or not. It only takes a few minutes to complete.

The 2020 Census count impacts the federal funds that communities receive each year for programs and services that are critical for schools, students, and younger children, such as:
-Special education, Head Start, after-school programs, and classroom technology.
-Food assistance, including free and reduced-price school lunches.
-Maternal and child health programs.

Do your part and respond to the census below:
https://my2020census.gov/

Godley ISD is excited about the future, but we also adamant that we remember and preserve our history.

This morning our Superintendent, Dr. Dear, visited with some of our Godley alumni from the classes of 1942 and 1947. He was able to listen in as stories that took place during those years in some of our oldest school buildings that are still being used today were shared between old friends.

Taking a walk through the past makes us grateful for what makes Godley the great district it is: our people!

This morning, the 2-4 Intermediate Campus was unexpectedly placed on lockdown for approximately 20 minutes. After thoroughly following strict procedures, it was confirmed that the school building was clear and not under any threat. As it turns out, the lockdown was triggered by an office chair that was positioned near the alarm. Our team is working to ensure that said chair is no longer able to cause such mischief!

Our teachers, faculty, and students responded perfectly to this lockdown and everything ran smoothly as is often practiced. This is not something we were anticipating, but we are happy to know that in the event that it's necessary, we are prepared.

Everything and everyone is back up and running as usual. Happy Thursday!

One of our favorite Friday game night events is our Military Recognition.

Before games, we have the honor of recognizing former Godley students and alums who have or are currently serving our country in the military. They act as our honorary captains and flip the game coin.

This past Friday, we recognized United States Air Force veteran, Dion Turner, class of 1957. Mr. Turner served our country for 27 years and traveled back to Godley from Montana for homecoming. We were glad to have him back home, were honored to be able to recognize him, and are proud to have him as a lifetime Wildcat!

Thank you for serving our country, Mr. Dion Turner!

THANK YOU to everyone who donated to the Elementary School's September service project: North Texas Giving Day. They were able to make a big donation to the Ronald McDonald House Fort Worth!

Pictured is our very own student, Owen Turner, with the donations that were collected. Owen's family had a room at the RMH of Fort Worth during his treatment in 2014 for acute myeloid leukemia at Cook Children's. They were able to have a place to take a nap, shower, do laundry, have home-cooked meals, and just have a quiet place to escape.

Owen's mother, Allison, says, "They were truly our home away from home, and we are forever thankful."

Godley ISD is thankful for the RMHFW for providing such great care to the Turner family and so many more like them!

Godley ISD Throwback Thursday: 5-2-19
Tradition is to the community, what memory is to the individual. As our Godley community grows, we will preserve our small town identity by remembering and honoring our own. Here is the signed professional baseball contract from the Valdosta Dodgers in 1950, along with a note from the scout that recruited this Godley alumni. Extra points for knowing what his signing bonus was. We will proudly display this in our new Godley High School. Don’t forget to mark Oct. 11th (homecoming) and 12th on your calendar to attend the Godley reunion.
